Association.definition: demonstrates a statistically significant, biologically meaningful, or clinically relevant relationship that links to without explicitly establishing directionality or direct causation toward

Positive_Correlation.definition: positively regulates, activates, enhances, promotes, induces, or increases the expression, activity, level, or occurrence through a regulatory or mechanistic influence that supports a same direction relationship ending in
Positive_Correlation.causal: Regulatory or mechanistic influence that may imply contribution but not necessarily direct causation

Negative_Correlation.definition: negatively regulates, inhibits, suppresses, blocks, reduces, or downregulates the expression, activity, level, or occurrence through a regulatory or mechanistic influence that supports an opposite direction relationship ending in
Negative_Correlation.causal: Regulatory or mechanistic influence that may imply contribution but not necessarily direct causation

Bind.definition: physically binds to, directly interacts with, or forms a molecular complex through biochemical contact that results in stable or transient interaction involving

Cotreatment.definition: is administered, applied, or experimentally evaluated in combination or simultaneously within the same biological, pharmacological, or clinical context together with

Drug_Interaction.definition: alters, enhances, reduces, potentiates, interferes with, or modifies the pharmacokinetic or pharmacodynamic properties that determine the efficacy, metabolism, or toxicity of

Conversion.definition: undergoes biochemical, enzymatic, or molecular transformation, processing, cleavage, or metabolic change that produces or results in

Comparison.definition: is experimentally, clinically, or statistically evaluated against another condition or entity in a way that highlights differences or similarities relative to

Treatment.definition: is therapeutically administered or applied with the intent to treat, prevent, mitigate, alleviate, reduce severity, or improve clinical outcomes related to

Cause.definition: directly initiates, triggers, induces, or brings about the occurrence, development, or progression of a biological or pathological outcome defined as
